author: xtqqczze
body:
Follow-up to #13500.

`AsSpan().Slice(start, length)` -> `AsSpan(start, length)`

Micro-benchmarks show decrease in code size and ~1.6x speedup.

comments.author: xtqqczze
comments.body: @iSazonov Should we label the arguments, i.e. `AsMemory(0, index)` -> `AsMemory(start: 0, length: index)`?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
> @iSazonov Should we label the arguments, i.e. `AsMemory(0, index)` -> `AsMemory(start: 0, length: index)`?

I think we can skip this as obvious.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body:
:tada:`v7.2.0-preview.2` has been released which incorporates this pull request.:tada:

Handy links:
* [Release Notes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/tag/v7.2.0-preview.2)

title: Use AsSpan/AsMemory slice constructor
